line_1: And ev'ry Muse with Larpent's name expires.
line_2: Near him Apollo veils his heav'nly fires,

line_1: But as in full eclipse his light expires,
line_2: Back to its source our gelid blood retires;

line_1: At Kindling Hymen's, oft Love's Torch expires.
And half in Anguish of the Flight expires:
line_2: The Mouse still urges, still the Frog retires,

line_1: That faint, pale, languid Lamp, in Age, expires,
line_2: Except 'tis fed with Friendship's constant Fires:

line_1: Looks up, beholds thee, sighs, despairs, expires.
line_2: The grovelling burgher burns with secret fires,
Surrounded thus with Smoak, and Wrathful Fires,

line_1: Here One, a Dagger in his Breast, expires,
line_2: And quenches with his Blood his Am'rous Fires;

line_1: And like a meteor, while we gaze, expires:
And, while the grosser Part expires,
line_2: So Metals lie in chymic Fires;

line_1: But with her eau de luce in hand, expires,
line_2: Whose gentle bosom no resentment fires,

line_1: And each pale lamp successively expires;
line_2: Her spouse a tender confidence inspires,

line_1: And each pale lamp successively expires;
line_2: But with a fond embrace ere dawn again retires.

line_1: The widow'd Indian, when her lord expires,
line_2: Mounts the dread pile, and braves the funeral fires!

line_1: Is seen this Moment, and the next expires:
line_2: As smoke that rises from the kindling Fires

line_1: Rush through his veins, and writhing he expires!
line_2: In vain! — he drinks — and now the searching fires

line_1: Now Lyric SAPPHO in the Tide expires,
line_2: Now faithful PORCIA eats the living Fires.
